recipes.title: Guacomole
recipes.notes: use heirloom or cherry tomatoes is possible and make sure avocado is ripe. lots of salt (the fancier the better)

recipes.title: Oatmeal
recipes.notes: might seem like a good idea, but you probably shouldn't eat these raw

recipes.title: Sushi Bowl
recipes.notes: be careful not to get rice too sticky

recipes.title: Pad Thai
recipes.notes: using a blender to mix the sauce together really makes a difference (instead of hand mixing)

recipes.title: Avocado Toast
recipes.notes: usually just throw this together with whatever is in the fridge - add some beans or chickpeas and plenty of salt and pepper

recipes.title: Chili
recipes.notes: If possible, use kidney beans bought dry and then soaked and cooked with plenty of seasoning

recipes.title: everything salad
recipes.notes: If possible, use chickpeas bought dry and then soaked and cooked with plenty of seasoning

recipes.title: roasted potatoes with parsley aoli
recipes.notes: Be creative with adding your own seasonings

recipes.title: roasted cauliflower with avocado and cilantro
recipes.notes: cut cauliflower into florets and lightly coat with oil, then dust with paprika before roasting for 25 minutes at 400 degrees.

recipes.title: cabbage steaks with breadcrumbs
recipes.notes: Cut cabbage into steaks, liberally salt and lightly coat with oil, feel free to season with whatever you feel. Roast for 20 minutes at 400. Ideal when edges are a big burnt and crispy

recipes.title: red beans and rice
recipes.notes: similar to chili. really good with spicy italian beyond sausage
